intro.p: Castle Project has a well defined mission, that can be easily stated as

blockquote.strong: To provide a simple set of tools to speed up the development of common enterprise and web applications while promoting good architecture.

intro.p: We also need to state what we do not want to provide and what we do not want to be labeled:

ul.li: Castle is not a set of classes that must be specialized to create your application. Castle should not force you to adhere to a specific architecture.
Castle should not be all-or-nothing. The developer can use the tools he wants to use, and at the same time, use different approaches in different areas of his application in a peaceful manner.

Castle should not be configuration-driven, and more important, should not be XML-driven. Configuration should be used only to express external settings, or as a hint to help the application to assemble itself. We shall look forward to delivering self-assemblying capabilities.
